alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 05 at 6:11AM PST until January 06 at 11:50AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River at Coquille...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of farmland and low-lying areas throughout the flood plain along the Coquille River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 21.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM PST Wednesday was 21.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 21.6 feet this morning. It will fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.6 feet on 01/09/1976. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM PST.
